text:
Summary



JM Financial approves raising Rs 650 crore via securities.LT Foods QIP opens with a floor price at Rs 79.13 per share.Bank of Baroda to consider raising additional funds on Dec. 22.South Indian Bank sets one-year MCLR at 8.9 percent from Dec. 20.






Indian equity benchmarks rebounded as Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party looked set to rule Gujarat, an election that’s considered a bellwether before the national vote in early 2019.The S&P BSE Sensex rose 0.4 percent or 139 points to 33,601.68 and the NSE Nifty 50 Index advanced 0.54 percent or 55 points to 10,388.75.The Singapore-traded SGX Nifty, an early indicator of NSE Nifty 50 Index’s performance in India, rose 0.2 percent to 10,420.50 as of 6:40 a.m.





All you need to know going into trade today. https://t.co/N80JPXk0Nw pic.twitter.com/73fKAQIHbm— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) December 19, 2017
title: Stocks To Watch: JM Financial, Bank Of Baroda, South Indian Bank
